ProjectTitle: Understanding joint health: biomechanical and mechanobiological characterization of the bonecartilage interface
InitialFeedbackHistory:
15/09/2022
Thank you for submitting your revised DMP, just 2 small suggestions:
4. Documentation and metadata: Which documentation will you use, for example notebooks, protocols etc. DDI is a standard for social sciences and may not be the most appropriate for your data, you can adjust a general standard such as dublin core, but maybe the metadata collected with microCT and microscopy are already sufficient?
7. Sharing: Have you considered using a data repository for data preservation and sharing? Maybe the EMBL-EBI repositories may be suitable (www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/). If there is no disciplinary repository for your data you can consider using KU Leuven RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr).
If you like to learn more about documentation, metadata and data repositories please contact onderzoek2bergen@kuleuven.be

08/07/2022
You now submitted the data management information that is asked for in the proposal. At this stage of the project FWO asks a more elaborate data management plan. To write this you can use DMPonline KU Leuven (https://dmponline.kuleuven.be/), selecting the FWO template, here you can also find guidance. Alternatively, you can use the word template that you can find on the FWO website (www.fwo.be/en/the-fwo/research-policy/data-management-plan/). You can find more information on our RDM website: www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/dmp
label: good with suggestions
